lines.text: Ask a foolish question, and you get a foolish answer.

[to Joan]
If you're looking for bargains, go to a department store. Don't come to a track unless you want to get hurt.

[to Joan]
If you're here for the cure, maybe you and I could get together for dinner.
If I'm here for the what?
The cure - six weeks in the Nevada sunshine and you rid yourself of whatever ails you. You know, lumbago, matrimony, the common cold.
Have you ever been in Las Vegas?

Right in the middle of the Nevada desert you bump into a cockeyed oasis. It's a wide-open, 24-hour-a- day carnival that lives off three things - quick marriages, quick divorces, quick money, won and lost. $3 billion changed hands across the gambling table in Nevada last year, 3 billion. Those are the state's official figures and why not? Everybody likes to gamble. It's fun for most people, but for some people, it's a trap. It grabs down deep and won't let go.
Go to bed, Mrs. Boothe. If you have to have bad dreams, have them there. They do less damage.

[to Joan standing atop the Hoover Dam]
They tell me there's never been a single suicide off here, yet back in Chicago they drop off those high buildings like flies.
